title: Official Blind Review #2
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I did not assess the derivations or theory.
review:
This paper proposes a first step in the direction of 'real-world relevant RL approaches' in the sense of considering environments that don't halt their execution until an agent has finished its optimal action computation and execution but actually just go on being an environment. For this, the notion of a concurrent action is introduced.

The paper focuses on value-based RL approaches. It introduces modifications to the classical MDP formulation such that concurrent actions can be handled. From a theoretical perspective the resulting Bellman operators (for both continuous and discrete time) remain contractions and thus maintain q-learning convergence guarantees. Qlearning models are adopted to support concurrent actions and the experiments  demonstrate that the suggested enhancements are working well.
